sourceDesc.p: A TEI file created from Ethio-SPaRe data

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
Updated transcriptions in the title and in the list of manuscripts

note.desc: During the reign of King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon I (r. 1314-1344). According to local tradition the monastery was founded by monk Yamāna ʾAb, under King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon I.
note.ab: Gadām. At least 25 monks live in the community; there is a well-established church school. A more recent church dedicated to Takla Haymanot, associated with the monastery, is located in the vicinity.
Tābots (6?): Mary (?), Kidāna Mǝḥrat, Jesus, Four Living Creatures, George, separately one tābot of ʿAbiya ʾƎgziʾ was mentioned.

The church photographed by Denis Nosnitsin during the Ethio-SPaRe project.
85 Mss. photographed, 1 scroll, objects: EMQ-001 “Miracles of Mary”; EMQ-002 “Psalter”; EMQ-003 “Miracles of Mary”; EMQ-004 “The Book of Hawi”; EMQ-005 “Four Gospel”; EMQ-006 “Vita of Gabra Manfas Qǝddus”;
